nodes.description: 在穆斯林占多数的国家，极端组织普遍受到负面评价，但许多国家存在显著的支持。
nodes.support_text: On balance, extremist groups tend to receive negative ratings in the predominantly Muslim nations surveyed, although there are significant levels of support for these organizations in many countries.

nodes.description: 在巴勒斯坦，哈马斯的声望近年来下降，而其温和对手法塔赫受到更积极的评价。
nodes.support_text: Among Palestinians themselves, Hamas’ image has declined in recent years, and its more moderate rival Fatah is rated much more positively.

nodes.description: 约四分之一的巴勒斯坦人和近一半的约旦和埃及人认为哈马斯正面。
nodes.support_text: Still, about four-in-ten Palestinians rate Hamas favorably, as do nearly half in Arab neighbors Jordan and Egypt.

nodes.description: 黎巴嫩的什叶派穆斯林组织真主党在多个国家受到负面评价，但在黎巴嫩什叶派和巴勒斯坦人中非常受欢迎。
nodes.support_text: Similarly, views of the Lebanese Shia Muslim group Hezbollah are on balance negative, but significant minorities rate Hezbollah favorably in several nations, and it is highly popular among Lebanese Shia and Palestinians.

nodes.description: 阿拉伯国家、土耳其和印度尼西亚的大多数人对基地组织持负面看法。
nodes.support_text: Majorities in Arab nations, Turkey and Indonesia all have a negative opinion about al Qaeda.

nodes.description: 在巴勒斯坦领土，超过四分之一的人对基地组织持正面评价。
nodes.support_text: The terrorist organization receives it strongest support in the Palestinian territories, where more than one-quarter give al Qaeda a positive rating.

nodes.description: 在大多数国家，自杀式爆炸的支持有限，但巴勒斯坦穆斯林是明显的例外，68%的人认为这种暴力是正当的。
nodes.support_text: There is only limited support for suicide bombing in most of these nations, although Palestinian Muslims are a clear outlier: 68% say this kind of violence is justifiable.

nodes.description: 在埃及，对自杀式袭击的支持在过去四年中逐渐增加。
nodes.support_text: Moreover, in Egypt support for suicide attacks has gradually increased over the last four years.

nodes.description: 在约旦，对哈马斯的评价基本分为两半，47%的人表示正面，50%的人表示负面。
nodes.support_text: In Jordan, where Hamas receives its highest ratings, views about the organization are essentially divided: 47% express a favorable opinion, 50% an unfavorable one.

nodes.description: 在埃及，哈马斯的负面评价（51%）超过了正面评价（45%），这与两年前的正面评价（52%正面，44%负面）形成对比。
nodes.support_text: By a narrow margin, Egyptians give Hamas more unfavorable (51%) than favorable (45%) ratings. This is a shift from two years ago, when the balance of opinion was positive (52% favorable, 44% unfavorable).

nodes.description: 约四分之一的巴勒斯坦人（42%）对哈马斯表示正面评价，但在加沙地带只有34%的人持正面评价。
nodes.support_text: Roughly four-in-ten Palestinians (42%) express a positive view of Hamas, although this varies considerably across the two regions that comprise the Palestinian territories. In Gaza, which is controlled by Hamas, only 34% give the group a positive rating.

nodes.description: 在西岸地带，47%的人对哈马斯表示正面评价，51%的人表示负面评价。
nodes.support_text: In contrast, Palestinians living in the West Bank – which is controlled by Hamas rival Fatah – are almost evenly divided: 47% have a favorable view and 51% have an unfavorable opinion.

nodes.description: 自2007年以来，哈马斯在巴勒斯坦的声望已经下降，现在比更世俗的法塔赫更不受欢迎。
nodes.support_text: Hamas’ popularity has waned since 2007, when about six-in-ten Palestinians held a positive view of the organization. And it is now considerably less popular than the more secular Fatah, which receives a favorable rat...

nodes.description: 在约旦，将 themselves 识别为巴勒斯坦人的对哈马斯的支持（53%正面）高于将 themselves 识别为约旦人的（39%）。总体而言，自去年以来，约旦对军事主义伊斯兰组织的支持已大幅下降，当时六分之一的人表示他们 favorably 观看哈马斯。
nodes.support_text: Support for Hamas is higher among those in Jordan who identify as Palestinian (53% favorable) than among those who identify as Jordanian (39%). Overall, support for the militant Islamist group has slipped considerably in Jordan since last year, when six-in-ten said they viewed Hamas favorably.

edges.support_text: On balance, extremist groups tend to receive negative ratings in the predominantly Muslim nations surveyed, although there are significant levels of support for these organizations in many countries. Among Palestinians themselves, Hamas’ image has declined in recent years, and its more moderate rival Fatah is rated much more positively.

By a narrow margin, Egyptians give Hamas more unfavorable (51%) than favorable (45%) ratings. This is a shift from two years ago, when the balance of opinion was positive (52% favorable, 44% unfavorable).

In Jordan, where Hamas receives its highest ratings, views about the organization are essentially divided: 47% express a favorable opinion, 50% an unfavorable one. Support for Hamas is higher among those in Jordan who identify as Palestinian (53% favorable) than among those who identify as Jordanian (39%). Overall, support for the militant Islamist group has slipped considerably in Jordan since last year, when six-in-ten said they viewed Hamas favorably.
